title: retro typefaces
content:
hi there,

i’m looking for typefaces that would feel nice on old cassettes, like in this picture:

[http://www.effektivedesign.co.uk/files/gimgs/1\_latest-cassette-badges2.j...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628181004/http:/www.effektivedesign.co.uk/files/gimgs/1_latest-cassette-badges2.jpg "http://www.effektivedesign.co.uk/files/gimgs/1\_latest-cassette-badges2.jpg")

actually i’m looking specially for the one used in the grey cassette, “C-60”, in red [with white stripe].

any further font indication would be appreciated. the strokes[the band]-like fonts, fonts used in old soccer uniforms (like the square numbers used by the netherlands in the last WC), avant garde alternates style fonts, helvetica-like and so on.

thank you in advance.

 [‹ Onlab - Ski Club Tramalan - Serif ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628181004/http:/typophile.com/node/46780 "Go to previous forum topic") [what is this font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628181004/http:/typophile.com/node/46792 "Go to next forum topic")
author: victornogueira

comments.content:
I see Helvetica/Avant Garde in all ;D

For the Lined C-60 and same retro feel, a good reference  
made by Michael Yanega!

[http://www.bowfinprintworks.com/LinedFontGuide02.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628181004/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/LinedFontGuide02.html "http://www.bowfinprintworks.com/LinedFontGuide02.html")
this guide will really help me. thank you!
